text: Marek Chrobak is a full professor at University of California, Riverside. He is known for his work competitive analysis of online algorithms, particularly for the k-server problem, on information dissemination in ad-hoc radio networks, and on graph drawing. In automata theory, Chrobak is known for his contributions to the study of finite automata over a one-letter alphabet. In particular, "Chrobak normal form" for nondeterministic finite automata is known. Chrobak obtained his PhD in Computer Science from Warsaw University in 1985. ==References== ==External links== * ** Bibliography of papers on online algorithms * * * * * Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:University of California, Riverside faculty Category:University of Warsaw alumni
title: Marek Chrobak
